channel.title: Anonymous Classes, packaging, executables
channel.description:
I was just reading about anonymous classes and searching up some about it after seeing classname$# being created after compiling my program.
So I have the basic understanding of what it is and that it is required for using the program, but I was curious if lets say I was going to make my program into an executable jar file, would I have to include all the anonymous classes or just my main class? would this change my manifest or would i just put in my main class?
Also does anyone know how to make an .exe for your java program? My teacher said you can include all the packages and put your program as an exe so anyone can use your program without having jdk (or java i forget) and stuff installed on the user's computer. <-- couldn't find anything useful in google.

item.title: Anonymous Classes, packaging, executables
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

you have to put in all the class files, it would only change the manifest if you signed it but thats done automatically anyway

Read full topic

item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

Jar2exe.com

Jar2exe.com

Jar2Exe v2.0. Java redistribute solution for Windows, Linux and Mac OS X. Wrap, run, protect and enhance your java program into binary file for Windows and Linux. Find JRE on host by itself. Encrypt and protect your java program. Run as Service...
